p: Individuals who personally experience extreme weather events such as a heat wave, hurricane, wildfire, prolonged drought, or falling through ice may experience distress, anxiety, and other emotional consequences [ 13, 51]. Berman et al. [ 63] found a 15% increase in suicide among rural male farmers when severe drought was present. The uncertainties of climate change in the future can cause individuals chronic stress and anxiety [ 13, 63].
